quote: Captain's log, Stardate 43042.3.   We are cautiously entering the   Delta Rana star system three   days after receiving a distress   call from the Federation colony   on its ninth planet.
The garbled transmission reported   the colony under attack from an   unidentified spacecraft. Our   mission is one of rescue and --   if necessary -- confrontation with   a hostile force.
Shields up, maximum strength.
Shields up.       Sensors do not indicate the   presence of any armed space   vehicles operating in the Rana   system.
They could be cloaked or otherwise   shielded.
Mister Crusher, bring us in well   clear of the planet's three moons.
Aye, sir.
Commander, I am not receiving   Rana Four's call sign.
Open a frequency to Colony   Operations.
There is no response. Rana Four   is emissions quiet.
Captain, there are eleven thousand   inhabitants in the colony. At   this range I should be feeling   something.... I'm not.
Mister Data, put the planet   on the Main Viewer.
Magnify.
My God...
Helm, put us in a high equatorial   orbit. Scan for survivors.
Survivors? Down there?
Sensors are scanning ninety   degrees of longitude as we orbit.   I am detecting no artificial   structures, no vegetation, no   bodies of water...
Lifeform readings are negative.
Could the colonists have escaped?
That is unlikely. Rana Four   possessed no interstellar   spacecraft.
Who could cause devastation on   such a scale?
Hold it -- hold it! I'm getting   something at thirty-seven degrees   north, sixty-two degrees east --   a structure!
Life?
Two lifeforms. Possibly human.
Put the area on the Main Viewer   and magnify.
The structure is located at the   center of the vegetation.
An entire planet obliterated...   except for a few acres of trees   and grass... and one building?
It's some kind of illusion...
Negative. It is as you see it.
Number One, I think you had better   see who's home...
If they're the only survivors   of a global holocaust, they can't   be in very good shape.
Counselor... ?
What I sense of them is human...
And something else... ?
It's difficult to explain... I   feel these two people are   somehow... different.       I'm sorry. I cannot be any   clearer than that.
We're ready.
Good luck, Number One.
Energize...
What can you tell me?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: The house is a typical settlement   structure with adaptations. Its   thermal properties all seem to   conform to known materials.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: If there are indicators as to why   this particular area has remained   intact, I cannot detect them.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Worf, the interior of the house.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: One individual is located at the   south end of the house, the other   toward the north. There is a   weapon -- a low-yield phaser,   nonfunctional -- in proximity to   the front-room individual.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I guess a frontal assault is   unwarranted. Stay here. I'm   going to try an old-fashioned   knock on the door.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Commander, there's a --
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Who's there? Who are you people?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Commander William Riker, USS   Enterprise, and crewmembers. May   I get down and approach you, sir?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: You leave him right where he is.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Commander, shall I incapacitate   him?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: No.       We're a rescue party. We picked   up your colony's distress call   and came as fast as we could.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Kevin, what are you doing? Can't   you see they're here to help us?   Can't you see they're human?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Stay in the house, Rishon. It   could be some kind of trick.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: We'd just about given up hope.   We thought maybe the whole   Federation had been attacked.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Do you know of any other   survivors?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: It's been days since we've seen   or heard anybody else...       Please, no -- don't tell me we're   the only ones...
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: They came in a spaceship so big   you could see it up in orbit.   They took our world apart piece   by piece.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Who?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: We don't know. We never saw   their faces.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: You don't know where they came   from -- where they are now?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I guess they've gone away.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I'm sorry. I'm only performing   a physical. Could I have your   names please -- for the record.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I'm Rishon Uxbridge... and this   is my husband Kevin.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Botanists. Originally from the   aquatic city New Martim Vaz in   the Atlantic Ocean on Earth.   Residents of the Rana Four   colony for five years.       You, ma'am, are eighty-two years   of age and a composer of   Tao-classical music.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: You, sir, are eighty-five years   of age and a specialist in   symbiotic plantlife. You have   been married fifty-three years.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I memorized the colony register   on the way to Rana in the event   such information was needed.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Is something wrong?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Your house -- with your permission   I'd like to look inside.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Why? What could interest you   in there?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Mister Uxbridge, as far as we've   been able to determine, you and   your wife -- and this house --   are all that survived the attack.   It was either a bizarre   coincidence or by design. I   don't favor the coincidence   theory.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Are you saying we were left alive   intentionally?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: Yes.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I don't understand. You don't   think Rishon and I did something   to merit our survival, do you?   I mean, betrayed the others... ?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I'm not accusing you of anything,   Mister Uxbridge. The attacking   force spared you for some reason.   We're only trying to find out why.       May I look inside... ?
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I said you could.
scene: 8    EXT. RANA IV - ESTABLISHING SHOT - HOUSE - DAY

quote: I'll make a cup of tea for   everyone. We have wonderful tea   on Rana. It grows wild nearly   everywhere...
Sir, may I say that your attempt   to hold our away team at bay with   a nonfunctioning weapon was an   act of unmitigated gall.
Didn't fool you, huh?
I admire gall.
Excuse me. Out front -- that   was about the best job of   concealing a snare that I've ever   seen. Could you tell me what it   was for?
Got a local critter that's   developed a taste for what's in   the garden.       Guess I should've dismantled it.   Guess I don't have to worry about   him anymore.
Go ahead. Pick it up. It's a   music box. It's been in my   family for generations.
I've been in every room. There's   nothing unusual about this house   except that it's here. What about   them?
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: They're in reasonably good health.   Both show signs of mental stress.   Understandable considering what   they've been through.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: But somehow they're different.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Let's get back to the ship. We'll   take them with us.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Excuse, Mrs. Uxbridge. We have   to return to the ship now.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Commander, I haven't finished   fixing your tea --
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: I'm sorry, but we're finished   here. We can give you and Kevin   time to pack. You can bring as   much as you want.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: What do you mean pack?
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: You're not thinking of taking us   with you, are you?
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Surely you don't want to remain   here. How will you take care of   yourselves?
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Kevin, I can't leave my home!   Don't let them do this to us.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: No one's going to make us leave.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: You'll be protected on the ship.   You could still be in danger on   Rana.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Commander, we appreciate your   concern but we're not going   anywhere. We'll manage. We   always have.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: All right. I can't make you come   with us. Are you familiar with   one of these... ?
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: We'll remain in this system for   the next several days at least.   If you should reconsider, please   contact us.
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: We'll be fine, Commander. We have   each other...
scene: 18   INT. ENTERPRISE - TROI'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Are they collaborators? Did they   in fact provide their colony's   assailants with something that   abetted the total destruction of   Rana Four in order to protect   their own lives?
What could two botanists in their   eighties possess that could   possibly aid whoever attacked this   planet?
We have no idea what the enemy   needed, Doctor. Love, fear, hope   -- a cup of tea. It is a strange   universe we live in.
Maybe they're being held hostage   in some fashion.
Nothing in the tricorder readings   indicated emotional stress.
Counselor... ?
Counselor Troi... ?
I'm sorry... I can't sense them   well enough...
Specimens...       Maybe they've been preserved as   specimens... pets... trophies...   exhibits in a zoo...
No. The assailants would have   picked someone younger for that,   someone who would have given them   a proper show for their money.
Number One, you say the couple   is incapable of sustaining   themselves?
There's a fusion reactor in the   house, probably good for another   five years of power. But their   watertable is tainted and they   have no way of feeding themselves   other than a small garden.
They won't come to the ship?
They were adamant.
We'll do all that we can to help   them... but in the meantime I want   them kept under surveillance.
Counselor, is something wrong?
I'm sorry... I don't feel well.   I would like to go to my   quarters...
By all means.
Is there anything I can do?
Captain, a search of the Ranian   system has determined that the   hostile force that attacked this   planet is no longer present.
I remember a Starfleet admiral   saying the same thing about some   renegade Andorians in the   Triangulum system once. The truth   was they'd dismantled their ship   and hidden it.
Those Andorians did not have to   contend with someone of my   thoroughness. I will stake my   reputation.
Don't listen... think of something   else...
Stop... please stop!
Yes --
I was concerned. I came to see   if I could be of any help.
I'm fine. There's nothing wrong.   I'm tired, that's all.
I don't have your gift for reading   emotions, Counselor, but I can   tell when someone is in pain and   hiding it.
It's silly... I... I hear music.   Music that won't stop. In my   mind.
Perhaps it's a symptom of   fatigue. We've all been inflicted   one time or another with the song   that wouldn't quit.
No... it's deeper than that. The   song never stops for an instant.   It plays in perfect clarity from   beginning to end over and over   again.
I don't even know what song it   is -- I've never heard it before!
When did this start?
A few hours ago. While the away   team was on the surface. I was   trying to... I was thinking of   Rishon and Kevin...
Rishon and Kevin... And?
I can't explain. They're elusive.   They're... I'm sorry...
Get some rest. Take the necessary   sleep inducements if you have to.
Data, give us a visual.   Magnfication factor fifty.
Where did that come from?
Apparently it was riding a   Lagrange point behind Rana   Four's furthest moon.
Our vehicle classification index   can put no identity to it. Its   design is completely foreign.
But it's our boy -- roughly five   times our mass and carrying enough   armament to pulverize a planet.
Lieutenant Worf... ?
I... cannot explain this, Captain.
It's moving toward the planet.
Open a hailing frequency, Data.   Ask them to identify themselves   and to match orbit with us.
They have received the message,   Captain, but are chosing to ignore   it.
Worf, maximum shields, ready all   weapon systems.
Aye, sir.
It's assuming an attack posture.   Don't be surprised if --
The vessel is firing jacketed   streams of positrons and   antiprotons, equivalent firepower   of forty megawatts. Shields are   holding.
Again forty megawatts. No damage.
If that's as good as they can do,   this'll be over in five minutes.
Worf, fire phasers... Just a   warning shot. Data, repeat the   order to stand to.
The vessel has assumed a course   out of the Rana system and is   rapidly increasing velocity.
Helm, initiate pursuit.
Aye, sir.
The vessel has reached warp two   and continues on a steady   acceleration curve. We aren't   getting any closer, Commander.
Give us a superior curve, Mister   Crusher.
Warp three... warp four... The   warship is simultaneously matching   our curve point per point. Warp   four point five... warp five...   warp five point five...
Riker to La Forge. Give us   everything you can to close the   gap, Geordi.
Yes, sir. I'll get you to   Nine point three seven in fifteen   seconds.
Warp eight point five... warp   eight point seven five... warp   nine... the warship continues to   match our acceleration curve   perfectly.
I get the impression we're being   toyed with, Number One.
This ship will not chase a pony   on a merry-go-round. Number One,   take us back to Rana Four.
Back?
We have unfinished business   there. I need to have a talk with   those two people.
Reduce speed. Bring us around   on a return course.       This one's getting away...

Good afternoon. I apologize if   I startled you. I'm Jean-Luc   Picard, captain of the Enterprise.       I've brought you something you   badly need if you're going to stay   on Rana -- a matter replicator.   It has limited capabilities, but...
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: Thank you. But we have no use   for such a thing.
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: It will provide you with food   and clothing -- clean water.   Lieutenant Worf can instruct you   in its operation.
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: We don't need it.
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: Kevin, you know we do.       Thank you, Captain.
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: Kevin and I were about to have   our afternoon tea. You and Mister   Worf must stay and have some with   us.
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: We'd like that very much.
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: Rishon, they only want to spy on   us like this morning.
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: Kevin, I've never turned away a   visitor to this house and I'm not   starting today.       Please come in, both of you. And   excuse the mess...
scene: 40   EXT. RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: RANA IV - FRONT OF HOUSE - DAY

quote: Stop -- make it stop! Please,   I'll do anything -- make it stop!
Deanna, please. I'm here to help.
It's getting louder! So loud...   I can't stand it -- make it stop!
Move her to the bed.
This will relax you.
I hear it! It's still there!   It's so loud --
Move her to Sickbay.
No! I want to stay in my   quarters.
I can get you to sleep there.
I don't want to sleep! The music   will only follow me!
I can induce delta sleep... Tune   out even your deepest dreams.
But it's not a dream! You've got   to understand that! It's not a   dream -- it's real!

Kevin and I first saw each other   on a ship at sea. He was a   starving student in a threadbare   suit and mismatched shoes. I was   traveling with my parents who   didn't like the way he was hanging   around. I asked him to marry me   two hours after we met and he knew   I was serious. I don't think he's   ever recovered from that day.
Mister Worf, what do you think?
Good tea. Nice house.
Why did you leave Earth and move   to a brand new world when you did?
You mean at our age? We thought   it would make us fall in love all   over again.       It worked.
It must've been terrible... when   the colony was fighting for its   life.
Yes, it was. Fire lit the sky...   the ground never stopped   shaking... there was thunder,   unbelievable thunder...
But you survived...
We don't know why we did and the   others didn't. I've tried to put   some purpose to it, but I can't.
I was wondering, Captain, when   you and your ship would be   leaving...

I don't have an answer for that.   A few hours ago we had an   encounter with a warship...   Possibly the one which attacked   you. We forced it to leave the   system but were unable to affect   it otherwise. It could return.
Kevin -- you said it'd gone away.
I guess I was wrong. Don't worry.   It didn't hurt us before, it won't   hurt us now.
Do you know that for a fact,   Kevin?
No. But I don't enjoy seeing my   wife frightened. As we've told   you time and time again, Captain,   we don't know why we were spared.

But there had to have been a   reason. In some way you and   Rishon were "different" from the   other colonists. Your   geographical location, your   philosophical beliefs, the color   of your eyes -- somehow you stood   apart from them.
There was a difference... I am   a man of special conscience.   While the others were doing what   they could, I chose not to fight.
That is your protected right.
But I assure you the attacking   ship had no way of realizing this.   I expected to die like all the   others.
There's no reason for you and your   ship to remain, Captain. We can   manage without you.
Kevin grieved for the others but   he did nothing. He's a very   gentle man. Please understand   that.
What about you, Rishon? Did you   feel the same way?
I wanted to fight... but I stayed   with my husband. Thank you again   for the replicator, Captain. I   had better clean up now...
Before we go I ask you one more   time to come to the ship. For   your own safety.
I'm frightened, Captain. But I   can't leave Rana. Even if it   means my life.

I don't understand it. I've   inhibited almost all the activity   of the neocortex and she   continues to behave as if she's   hearing the music...       We're going to have to shield   her from all outside stimuli by   inducing coma...
I have positive identification,   Commander. It is the vessel that   attacked us earlier. It is   reentering the system at high   velocity and is approaching   Rana Four.
Give us a tight visual, Data.
Is it my imagination or does it   look a lot meaner this time?       Shields up. Weapons ready.
Our friend is back.
I am not surprised. Lieutenant   Worf, open a hailing frequency.   Warn the vessel to stay clear of   the planet.
Aye, sir. But they are already   within firing range.
Shields down! Captain, they hit   us with four hundred gigawatts   of particle energy!
Damage?
Superficial -- but I am having   trouble reassembling the shields!
Shields down! There is thermal   damage to the hull!
The warship is in possession of   enormous energy reserves. It is   capable of striking us with   far more powerful bursts.
They're maneuvering to come   between the Enterprise and Rana   Four.
Number One, we have been exemplary   in our patience.
Lieutenant Worf, fire phasers on   full with a simultaneous spread   of torpedoes.
The vessel appears undamaged.   Its defenses are apparently able   to absorb incoming matter and   energy.
Commence rapid fire with all   weapons on full!
Shields are down! There is   internal damage -- weapon systems   control has been lost!
Riker to Sickbay. Medical   assistance to the bridge!
Mister Crusher, move the   Enterprise out of range of the   attacking vessel!
The vessel has terminated its   pursuit. It is assuming an orbit   around Rana Four.
Rishon and Kevin...
We can't help them... But it's   my guess they're in no danger.
Number of casualties?
Sixty-six.
Fatalities?
None. We've been able to treat   everyone.
Can you help her?
I've done everything I can. I   don't understand the nature of   this music she says she's hearing,   or where it's coming from.
Could it be telepathic?
Yes. But I'm no expert at   determining that.
They're blocking her sensitivity   ... keeping her from "seeing"   the truth.
Who?
Rishon and Kevin.
What?
They wanted us to leave Rana...   and that's exactly what we're   doing.
Picard to bridge.
Yes, Captain.
Number One, I want you to maintain   the present course for another   hour, then turn the Enterprise   around and take it back to Rana   Four.
Sir? We still won't have our   shields restored by then.
We're going back, Commander --   and this time nothing is going   to lure us away.
Sensors indicate no spacecraft   in the vicinity of Rana Four.    (remembering his     previous failure)   But Captain --
Forget your previous error,   Lieutenant. There was no way   you could have prevented it.
Captain, the Uxbridge house is   coming into transporter range.
Lieutenant Worf. If you will   accompany me to the Transporter   Room...
I think you should reconsider   this, Captain. The warship has   come after us twice, it could come   back.
I disagree, Commander. I don't   think it knows we're here. I   think it believes it's run us off   for good. That, however, will   change once I'm back on board.
Sir?
It's protecting Rishon and Kevin.   It responds to their wishes --   directly or indirectly, I'm not   sure. That's what I'm going to   put to the test.
Celebrating?
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: What are you doing here? What   do you want?
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: This is the second time you've   shown surprise at my appearance,   Kevin. The first time was   understandable, but why now? --   unless you expected never to see   me again.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Why do you keep interfering with   our lives, Captain?
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: It isn't my intention to   interfere, Kevin... only to help   you and Rishon.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Then please leave us alone.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: I promise you that once I leave   this house I will never set foot   in it again. The Enterprise,   however, will remain in orbit over   this planet.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Why?
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: To protect you.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: That isn't necessary, Captain.   I thought you understood.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: But it is necessary, Kevin. Your   lives are in great danger. The   warship has returned.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Kevin --
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: He's lying, Rishon.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: We fought a pitched battle with   it and lost. Many of my crew have   been injured -- including a woman   who's mind is slowly being   destroyed by a telepathic   aberration.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: No! Oh please no!
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: This is a form of intimidation.   I have my rights --
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: You, Kevin? What about Rishon?   Is she in favor of being left   at the mercy of a homicidal   spaceship?
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: I think you'd better go,   Captain...
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Come to the Enterprise, Rishon.   Let me take you where you'll be   safe.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: No. I can't leave Kevin...
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: And I'm staying. She's safe here   with me in this house.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Then explain to me why you're   safe, Kevin. Why is this house   a sanctuary from a destructive   force that otherwise has no   conscience? Does it have to do   with you -- with your refusal to   fight?
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Tell me this, Kevin. If Rishon   were in danger, would you kill   to save her life?
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: No! Not for her, not for anyone!   I will not kill!
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Stop hurting him! Leave our   house!
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: It is my sworn duty to protect   you. The Enterprise will remain   in orbit around Rana Four as   long as the two of you are alive.
scene: 59   INT. HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - KEVIN AND RISHON

quote: Number One -- an update, please.
Little change, Captain. The   shields are still inoperable.   We have partial control of our   weapons. I've doubled the repair   crews.
Commander. The warship is   approaching from high orbit. It   is very close -- three hundred   thousand kilometers distance.
How is that possible? Is   something wrong with the sensors?
That's of no concern, Number One.   It's here. And precisely on   schedule.
The vessel has altered its course   to a direct intercept with the   Enterprise.
Worf, arm phasers and photon   torpedos, prepare to fire.
Belay those orders, Mister Worf.
The vessel is now within twenty   thousand kilometers of the   Enterprise and closing.
Let it come, Commander. Activate   the Main Viewer.
Evasive action, sir?
The Enterprise will stand its   ground, Lieutenant.
Weapons, sir?
When I give the order. Not   before.
The vessel is entering a low   orbit around Rana Four.       Captain, it appears it is   preparing to fire at the planet.
Understood.
My calculations indicate that its   target may be the house of Rishon   and Kevin Uxbridge.
There will be no interference from   us, Mister Data.
The house has been obliterated!
Scan for survivors, Lieutenant.
There are no survivors.
Ready a photon torpedo. Fire at   the vessel when ready.
Aye, sir.
Commander Riker. What reason does   the Enterprise have to remain at   Rana?
scene: 65   EXT. SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE AND WARSHIP (OPTICAL)

quote: The unknown vessel has been   destroyed. The Uxbridges have   been destroyed. There is no   reason for the Enterprise to   remain.
scene: 65   EXT. SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE AND WARSHIP (OPTICAL)

quote: Good. Helm, move us to a higher   orbit so that we may keep the   surface of the planet under   surveillance.
scene: 65   EXT. SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE AND WARSHIP (OPTICAL)

quote: Aye, sir. But, Captain, what do   we watch for?
scene: 65   EXT. SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE AND WARSHIP (OPTICAL)

quote: Anything. If I'm needed I will   be in my Ready Room. That is all   for now.
scene: 65   EXT. SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE AND WARSHIP (OPTICAL)

quote: Come.
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ON PICARD

quote: Captain, may I speak with you?
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ON PICARD

quote: The pleasure is mine, Number One.
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ON PICARD

quote: We've been observing the planet   very carefully for three hours.   We've seen nothing. I have the   feeling you're waiting for   something to happen.
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ON PICARD

quote: I have acted on an assumption,   Commander. I am not sure what   the result will be -- or even that   my assumption is correct.       We found two people alive in a   house on a devastated planet.   But there was only one survivor   of the war on Rana Four
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ON PICARD

quote: Why is it we maintain watch on   a planet that is now totally dead?
Bridge to Captain Picard. You   had better come see this.
Captain, Commander, it's back --   the house! And the trees and the   grass! It happened right in   front of us.
Worf, do you see survivors?
I detect two life-forms inside the   house. It appears Kevin and   Rishon were not destroyed. But   how... ?
Helm, bring us into transporter   range. I want them beamed aboard   -- directly to the bridge.
Captain, will they not protest?
Let them.
My apologies if I interrupted a   waltz...
Why have you brought us here   against our will?
To end the suffering of one of   my crewmembers.
I don't understand --
Kevin does. He's the cause.

At first I couldn't figure out   why your house had survived the   holocaust while all the others   hadn't. And then it occurred   to me that it had been destroyed.   The dwelling where you served me   tea and danced your waltzes was   a reproduction, something real   to the touch but capable of being   created and destroyed and   recreated at whim.
Now you're joking with us,   Captain. Can't you see it's   hurting my husband?
(suddenly;     fatalistically)   Rishon... hear what he has to say.
More than anything, you wanted   the Enterprise away from Rana.   Why?

Because the house, the plot of   land, your very own existence,   were riddles you were helpless   to explain. The warship --   another recreation -- twice tried   to chase us away but failed.   When I came to the house a second   time I provided you with the only   condition that would make the   Enterprise leave -- your deaths   -- and you did your best to   satisfy me.
I am deeply sorry about the   woman. I will help her. But   I must know what you intend to   do with me afterwards...
Take you to the nearest starbase   where you will be held accountable   for the attack on this ship...   and perhaps the deaths of eleven   thousand people.
No! He hasn't killed anyone!
The destruction of the planet   happened just as I told you.
But you haven't told us the whole   story, Kevin -- how it ended...   the part about Rishon.
What is he saying... ?

I can touch you, Rishon. Hear   your voice. Smell your perfume.   In every respect you are a real   person with your own mind and your   own beliefs... but you do not   exist. You died with the others,   defending the colony. He has   recreated you just as he has   recreated the house.
You're the only living thing that   really exists on Rana Four,   Kevin. And though you look   human, you're not.
He's in the turbolift!
Let him go.
Captain -- he is dangerous!
So dangerous, Lieutenant, he could   have destroyed us at any instant   he wished. Track him. Alert the   crew to keep out of his way. I   want him to know we mean him no   harm...
Will he try to get back to the   planet?
Not if he's the creature of   conscience I think he is. He has   someone to help first...
I have taken the music from her   mind. She's alright now. She's   sleeping.

(continuing; deeply     sorry)   She was beginning to sense who   I really was. I've been living   as a human for over fifty years   but I couldn't hide from her.       She has suffered because of my   pride and selfishness. It will   not happen again.
What happened on Rana Four,   Kevin? The truth this time --   all of it.

Very well. For what it's worth.       I am a Douwd... an immortal being   of disguises and false   surroundings. I have lived in   this galaxy for many thousands   of years although until today no   one has known my true identity.   Once while traveling in human   form I chanced to fall in love   with an Earth woman. I put aside   my powers and became her husband.   Our life was happy and rich.   Eventually we came to this planet   to live our final years. Now she   is dead. She never knew what I   really was...
Your colony was attacked by a   warship...
Belonging to the Husnock, a   species of hideous intelligence   that knew only aggression and   destruction. I could have   destroyed them with a mere   thought, but this I did not do.
You had the power to stop them   and you didn't?
I refused to for the same reason   I refused to stop the Enterprise.   I will not kill!
So you let the colonists fight   a hopeless battle.
I tried to fool the Husnock as   I tried to fool you, but it only   made them angrier and more cruel.
And then what you feared most   happened. Rishon went to fight   with the others -- and she died   with them.
How I wish I could have died with   her...
But you couldn't. You did the   unthinkable instead. You took   revenge.
Yes! I saw her broken body. I   went insane! My hatred exploded   and in an instant of grief I   destroyed the Husnock!
Why did you try to hide this from   us? Was it out of guilt for not   helping Rishon and the others when   they were alive?
No. You don't understand the   scope of my crime. I didn't kill   just one Husnock, or a hundred,   or a thousand -- I killed them   all. All! The mothers, the   babies, all the Husnock   everywhere!

Are eleven thousand people worth   fifty billion? Is the love of   a woman worth the destruction of   an entire species... ? This is   the sin I tried so hard to keep   you from learning. This is why   I wanted to chase you from Rana.
We are not qualified to be your   judges. We have no law to fit   your crime. You're free to return   to the planet... and to make   Rishon live again.
Helm... break orbit. Full   impulse.

Captain's log, Stardate 43043.5.   We are departing the Rana   system for Starbase   one three three. We leave behind   a being of extraordinary power...   and conscience. I am not certain   if he should be praised or   condemned. Only that he should   be left alone...
